intro: Clibadium heterotrichum, commonly known as the African snakeweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to sub-Saharan Africa and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features palmate leaves with three to five lobes and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. The plant is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats.
